data.title: Build vscode with conda
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
Well, this is related to #8950. I submitted a new issue because I can't re-open that issue.  
All functions ran OK after I compiled and installed vscode with [conda](https://anaconda.org/), except the error `The mode has failed while tokenizing the input.` popped up every time I opened a file or typed a character. Meanwhile, the syntax can't be highlighted. This can't be fixed by the solutions given by #8950.

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: CentOS release 6.8 (Final)
- conda: 4.1.12

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. make a folder, and put
2. following 2 files into the folder
`meta.yaml`:
```yaml
package:
    name: vscode
    version: 1.9.1
source:
    fn: vscode.rpm
    url: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=760867
build:
    number: '0'
requirements:
    build:
    run:
test:
    commands:
        - code
about:
    home: https://code.visualstudio.com/
    summary: Visual Studio Code is a lightweight but powerful source code editor which runs on your desktop and is available for Windows, macOS and Linux.
```

`build.sh`:
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash

rpm2cpio vscode.rpm | cpio -idv
mv usr $PREFIX
ln -s $PREFIX/usr/share/code/code $PREFIX/bin/code
libffmpegso=$PREFIX/lib/libffmpeg.so
libnodeso=$PREFIX/lib/libnode.so

if [ ! -d $PREFIX/lib ]; then
    mkdir $PREFIX/lib
fi

if [ ! -e $libffmpegso ]; then
    cp $PREFIX/usr/share/code/libffmpeg.so $libffmpegso
fi

if [ ! -e $libnodeso ]; then
    cp $PREFIX/usr/share/code/libnode.so $libnodeso
fi
```
3. run `conda build .` to build vscode
4. install it: `conda install vscode --use-local`

I checked the folder `$PREFIX/usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/vscode-textmate/node_modules`, it didn't exist. I also tried to make an empty one, which still didn't work.

Anybody has any ideas?

Thanks.

data.title: Use common TS install for both the TS Extension and Html Extension
data.body:
**Bug**
At least two version of Typescript are shipped in our builtin extensions: one in the typescript extension and one for the html extension. This adds about 5MB to package install size and also results in inconsistent behavior

**Fix**
Change the TypeScript extension to also use the common version of TypeScript. Bump this version up to 2.2.1

data.title: Windows npm.bat pathname bug prevents build with unclear errors (with verified bug fix )
data.body:
Development Environment:

OS: Windows 7 Professional SP1

Visual Studio 15 Community \ C++ Tools \ SDK
VS Code: 1.9.1 master release
Node: 6.9.1
NPM:  3.10.8

Description Of Bug:

npm.bat will fail on Windows if the vscode code tree/repository is in a subdirectory
with any directories with spaces in the path.  The error does not fatally
stop the script making it easy to miss the "cannot open" output from
the npm script.  The error also does not show up in the npm_debug.txt
file after many modules have been processed.

The bug is in line five, in the findstr command -

5 for /f "tokens=2 delims=:, " %%a in ('findstr /R /C:"\"electronVersion\":.*" %~dp0..\package.json') do set npm_config_target=%%~a

The file string:   %~dp0..\package.json

Will to evaluate to multiple files/folders for any path with spaces and folder names.
Thus %electronVersion does not get set but no fatal error stops the script.
Since the command output gets overrun from the npm output it's easy to miss the warning.
The actual error building electron comes much later and gives no clue as to the cause
(empty electronVersion value)

Steps to reproduce:

(working example) CheckOut code to:  C:\Dev\vscode

(failure example) CheckOut code to:  C:\VSC Dev\vscode
(Initial output to terminal NOT npm_debug_out)
FINDSTR: Cannot open C:\VSC
FINDSTR: Cannot open Dev\vscode\scripts\..\package.json
...subsequent npm output until electron failure

The Fix: Simply enclose the full file path string in double quotes

5 for /f "tokens=2 delims=:, " %%a in ('findstr /R /C:"\"electronVersion\":.*" "%~dp0..\package.json"') do set npm_config_target=%%~a

I also added an error level output so code.bat could detect an error.
Additionally command output with an explicit fatal error.

Can I submit these fixes?  I am embarrassed, but it took me three days
to catch this as all other similar issues I read on github pointed
to a toolchain issue. There our problems with the C++ tools install
that can lead you down a wrong path. I would like to add some notes
to the contribution wiki page.

Looking forward to contributing especially for accessibility
as a disabled\ALS user using voice programming - I really love
the vscode editor !

Cheers Christopher

data.title: Cannot multi-select items in SCM / Git Viewlet
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-insider
- OS Version: Mac

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a Git repository
2. Edit 2 files and save them
3. Go to the Git viewlet and click on the 1st file
4. Shift + Click to select the 2nd file (or Shift + Down Arrow)

Expected: 
- Both items are selected
- Note that in the 1.9.1 release, multi-select works just fine

Actual:
- Multi-select no longer works for either keyboard or mouse navigation

data.title: React Native packager still running in the background when debugger exists
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:31:51.320Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.6.2|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.8.8|
|alignment|annsk|0.3.0|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|prettier-vscode|esbenp|0.9.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.0.1|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.9|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.11|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.5|
|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.1|

---

When I debug a react native application in vs code the webpack packager is still running in the background even though I stop debugging. I have to completely quit the VS code window to kill it.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a react native project
2. Debug ios react native app with the following launch config
3. Stop the vs code react native debugger by hitting the red box stop button
4. Keep the window open
4. Run `react-native run-ios` from a terminal. Normally this would spawn another terminal. But in this case it won't because the webpack packager is running hidden in vs code.

If you're not familiar with react native. It spawns a separate terminal for the web pack packager. In VS Code that's still running somewhere in the background even though I have stopped debugging.

Not a huge deal. Just thought I would mention it. Thanks.

data.title: Collapse all children in explorer tree?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.0
- OS Version: 10.12.3

It would be most convenient if I could right-click a folder in the explorer tree and choose "collapse all children".  

Many times, over the course of the day, I have opened many folders and subfolders.  This makes it difficult to focus/locate what I am currently working on.  I need to close each folder and its parent(s) in turn.

MacOS' Finder has the ability to collapse a folder and all child folders by option-click on the disclosure
 triangle, as in

![feb-28-2017 12-34-44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/23416821/6a1bc184-fdb2-11e6-8135-7e32482d95bb.gif)

As you can see when I re-open it, the child folder had been closed along with its parent.

I would love to be able to do this with my main "app" folder, and then open it and open the child module I need to actually work on.

If you have a huge file where you only changed a few things and random places, this would let you get back to where the action is easily.

data.title: VSCode Causes Windows 10 to Freeze and Crash

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise x64
- Graphics Cards: Intel HD Graphics 530 (20.19.15.4531) / Nvidia Quadro M2000M (21.21.13.6949)
- Laptop: Dell Precision 7510 - Latest drivers for everything (as of 28/02/2017)
-  i7-6820HQ - 64GB RAM - 512GB Toshiba NVMe - Intel Display Audio + Realtek Audio

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode
2. Let or put laptop to sleep / power save.
3. Wake laptop up and start using.
3. After a short amount of time, the entire Windows GUI stops responding after a few more click the mouse freezes.

No ability to recover from this except a hard power cycle.

Windows outputs no errors in the Windows event logs.

This happens every time with VS code. It does not happen with anything else we have running. 

The same thing on multiple laptops of the same spec.

Compatibility mode (Win 7 / 8 ) does not help.

Not sure exactly where the problem lies (Windows 10 / Intel Graphics / Nvidia Graphics / VSCode) but as its only VSCode that does it, i'm starting by posting it here.

Thanks for any help/pointers or fixes.

If you need more info or logs please ask.

Extensions:

abusaidm.html-snippets-0.1.0
christian-kohler.npm-intellisense-1.3.0
christian-kohler.path-intellisense-1.2.0
dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.2.6
donjayamanne.bower-0.0.3
eg2.tslint-0.8.1
fknop.vscode-npm-3.3.0
msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-2.5.5
pflannery.vscode-versionlens-0.12.1
robertohuertasm.vscode-icons-7.3.0
robinbentley.sass-indented-1.3.0

wayou.vscode-todo-highlight-0.4.0

data.title: Ruby 2.3 tilda (squiggly) heredoc not recognised as a string
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a ruby file
2. Enter the following, observe lack of formatting

```
string = <<~STRING
Example heredoc squiggly heredoc introduced in ruby 2.3 not recognised as string
STRING
```

Original ruby heredoc format works fine. 
```
string = <<-STRING
Example heredoc standard heredoc not recognised as string
STRING
```

data.title: Word wrap  now won't 'unwrap'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (799198928b772d1def661d3cd7962f04b7f38b98, 2017-02-28T07:09:02.848Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-64-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|format-indent|Kasik96|1.3.0|
|php-intellisense|felixfbecker|1.1.3|
|phpcs|ikappas|0.7.0|
|vscode-spotify|shyykoserhiy|1.1.0|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to View -> Toggle Word Wrap
2. Hit Alt-z

Text remains wrapped no regardless of attempts to toggle word wrapping. Have also tried the following settings:

"editor.wordWrap": "on"
"editor.wordWrap": "off"

Which did nothing.

This used to work in 1.8. The behaviour changed in 1.9 and early versions of 1.10 and I could 'toggle' word wrapping by manually changing these settings:

"editor.wordWrap": true,
"editor.wrappingColumn": -1

But trying either Alt-z or going to View -> Toggle Word Wrap had no effect.

With the latest version of 1.10 I can no longer toggle word wrapping - no matter what I try the text remains wrapped.

Contrary to claims made in previous reports of this problem #21291 and #21487 something HAS changed since 1.8 as toggling word wrap used to work perfectly, it then went to having to be changed by going to File -> Preferences -> Settings and manually changing the settings to now where the settings cannot be changed at all.

data.title: 'Open recent' list should be longer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Choose: File -> Open recent
2. Open recent list is shown: 10 recent files & 10 recent folders.

If would be great if this list is longer or even better configurable. E.g. like it is in VS: "XX items shown in recently used list".
The same feature can be applied to the Welcome screen's Recent list.

data.title: Regression: hover no longer shows source preview
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. selfhost open `textFileEditorModelManager.ts`
2. ctrl-hover over the `disposeModelIfPossible` usage
3. notice you do not see the contents of the method anymore

=> works in stable
=> I am not sure if this is a TS issue or a hover issue
=> see video

![kapture 2017-02-28 at 10 50 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/23400302/dc416570-fda3-11e6-8f68-b587779b910d.gif)
